body:
Thanks for your response @josevalim.
To keep things separately I've created pull request for the issue with caching https://github.com/rails/rails/pull/6498
And to solve the issue with coercion, I've just [removed caching in write_method](https://github.com/edtsech/rails/commit/e6518264098bb152cb00913e2f33174b0478f9cf#L0R255)
Is't way to go? 
If not, maybe we can go back to solution with `instance_variable_set` to use it [here](https://github.com/rails/rails/blob/master/activerecord/lib/active_record/aggregations.rb#L254) to update `part` object back, because we usually don't have setters in aggregation part object and can't use them to update object. 
Wdyt @josevalim ? Thanks!
